cards.name: Sitting Heel Raises with Block
cards.description: Helps to coordinate movement of the entire lower extremity.

cards.name: Short foot
cards.description: Mimics proper foot and ankle movement during gait and starts to take away compensations in the load joints.
cards.ownIt: Do 3 sets of 10 repetitions on each side.

cards.name: Static Back
cards.description: Settles your hips and back, releasing the compensating muscles that interfere with balance and functional movement.

cards.name: Frog
cards.description: Releases the powerful thigh and groin muscles to allow the pelvis to settle into a neutral position.

cards.name: Foot Circles/Point Flexes
cards.description: Increases ankle mobility and restores balance to the muscles of the lower extremity.

cards.name: Calf/Hamstring Stretch
cards.description: Restores blalnce to all the muscles from the hip to the foot.
cards.ownIt: Hold it for 30 seconds on each side for both.

cards.name: Static Extension Position
cards.description: Improves pelvic and spine imbalance to improve load joint function.
tags: Shoulders No Pain but with Motion Restrictions

cards.name: Air Bench
cards.description: Puts the hips, knees and ankles simultaneously into flexion while they are under load.
cards.ownIt: Hold for 1 to 3 minutes or as long as you can.

cards.name: Standing Arm Circles
cards.description: Strengthens the muscles of the upper back and shoulders and balances the top of the kinetic chain and pelvis.
cards.ownIt: Do 50 with palms down and 50 with palms up.

cards.name: Abduction-Adduction with Narrow and Wide Feet
cards.description: Helps promote femur rotation and reduces imbalance in the pelvis and torso.
cards.ownIt: Do 2 sets of 10 repetitions of each position.

cards.name: Static Wall
cards.description: Engages and balances the muscles in the front of the thighs, lower legs and pelvis.

cards.name: Cats and Dogs
cards.description: Works the hips, spine, shoulders and neck in coordinated flexion-extension.
tags: Shoulders No Pain but with Motion Restrictions

cards.name: Cross Crawling
cards.description: Promotes proper and coordinated flexion and extension of the hips and shoulders simeltaneously.
cards.ownIt: Do 2 sets of 10 repetitions on each side.

cards.name: Flexion Knee Pillow Squeezes
cards.description: Helps the adductor muscles do their primary assignment, rather than trying to operate as gait muscles.

cards.name: Standing Quad Stretch
cards.description: Helps to balance the quadriceps and hamstring muscles to balance pelvis and torso position.
cards.ownIt: Hold for 1 minute on each side.

cards.name: Standing Forward Bend
cards.description: Allows for coordinated movement on both sides of the trunk and pelvis and balances muscles along the front and back of the body, stabilizing the pelvis.

cards.name: Progressive Supine Groin
cards.description: Allows fpr proper flexion and extension of the leg while reducing compensating side-to-side and rotational motions.
cards.ownIt: Hold each position for 3 minutes and repeat on the opposite side.

cards.name: Standing Wall with Pillow between Knees
cards.description: Promotes proper positioning of all load joints.

cards.name: Wall Stork
cards.description: Strengthens independent movement of the hips and balances the pelvis, torso and lower extremity.

cards.name: Lying Supine
cards.description: Helps to improve joint position and balance throughout the kinetic chain.

cards.name: Modified Floor Block
cards.description: Coordinates shoulder, torso and pelvic movement.

cards.name: Knee-Pillow Squeezes in Static Back
cards.description: Helps to balance pelvis and torso to allow proper movement of the hip and proper rotation of the femur.
cards.ownIt: Hold static back for 3 minutes then do 3 sets of 10 repitions of knee pillow squeezes.

cards.name: Hooklying Rocking Chair
cards.description: Improves range of motion in the ankle and coordinates the movement of the entire lower extremity.

cards.name: Hip Lifts
cards.description: Helps to reduce pelvic disparity and to balance femur and torso position.

cards.name: Pelvic Tilts
cards.description: Coordinates movement of the lower spine and pelvis.

cards.name: Floor Block
cards.description: Coordinates movement of the humerus and scapula and helps balance the torso and spine.
cards.ownIt: Hold for 1 minute in each position.

cards.name: Active Wishbone
cards.description: Reduces hip disparities and balances the pelvis and torso.

cards.name: Kneeling Counter Stretch
cards.description: Allows for symmetric spinal extension and balances the hips and shoulders from side to side.

cards.name: Gravity Drop
cards.description: Balances the rotation in the lower extremity and aligns the load joints.

cards.name: Hanging
cards.description: Elongates the muscles along the posterior side of the body, which often become tight and imbalanced from a lifestyle with too much sitting.

cards.name: Unilateral Supine Femur Rotations
cards.description: Increases femur rotation and coordinates action of the major movers in the hips, pelvis and lumbar spine.
cards.ownIt: Do 2 sets of 10 repetitions for each leg.

cards.name: Sitting Knee Pillow Squeezes
cards.description: Strengthens hip adductors and reduces disparity by placing balanced and systematic demand on the pelvis.
tags: Shoulders No Pain but with Motion Restrictions

cards.name: Reverse Presses
cards.description: Improves scapula mobility and reduces compensation in the thoracic spine.

cards.name: Pullovers
cards.description: Improves shoulder mobility and reduces compensation in the thoracic spine.

cards.name: Squat
cards.description: Properly recruits the major movers of the lower body and pelvis while reducing upper body compensation.
tags: Shoulders No Pain but with Motion Restrictions

cards.name: Three Posistion Toe Raises
cards.description: Coordinates and balances the motion of the load joints and various rotational demands on the lower extremity.
cards.ownIt: Do 2 sets of 10 toe raises in each position.

cards.name: Sitting Floor
cards.description: Promotes thoracic extension and upper body balance while eliminating rotattion in your lower extremities.
tags: Shoulders No Pain but with Motion Restrictions

cards.name: Seated Arm Circles
cards.description: Strengthens the muscles of the upper back and shoulders and balances the top of the kinetic chain and pelvis.
tags: Shoulders No Pain but with Motion Restrictions
cards.ownIt: Do 50 with palms down and 50 with palms up.

cards.name: Hero's Pose
cards.description: Promotes symmetric pelvic and torso position.

cards.name: Slant Board Ankle Sequence
cards.description: Uses the ankle joint to strengthen the muscles of the pelvis, activating the hip flexor so that the vertical posture facilitates dynamic tension from he front to the back of the body.

cards.name: Standing Chest Openers, Unilateral
cards.description: Improves humerus and scapula range of motion and balances shoulder motion with motion of the thoracic spine.
cards.ownIt: Do 2 sets of 10 repetitions on each side.

cards.name: Standing Chest Openers, Bilateral
cards.description: Improves scapula and shoulder range of motion and reduces thoracic spine and torso imbalance.

cards.name: Wall Clock
cards.description: Improves function of the scapula. The shoulder blades should move up and down, back and forth, clockwise and counter-clockwise. When they don't, much of the dynamic interaction within the torso is lost.
cards.ownIt: Hold each clock position for 1 minute.

cards.name: Shoulder Shrugs
cards.description: Promotes proper position of the scapula and throacic extension, while reducing imbalance in the torso and spine.

cards.name: Shoulder Rolls
cards.description: Promotes proper position and movement of the scapula and shoulder and reduces imblance in the torso and spine.
cards.ownIt: Do 2 sets of 10 repetitions in each direction.

cards.name: Wall Elbow Curls
cards.description: Promotes proper positioning of the load joints and synchronizes scapula movement with the thoracic extension and flexion.

Ankle Menu: Abduction-Adduction with Narrow and Wide Feet
Hips Pelvis (no Pain): Static Back with Knee Pillow Squeezes
Back - Lumbar Pain/Herniated Discs: Static Back with Knee Pillow Squeezes
